subtitleNullable: Betting odds to back individual candidates for US President
descriptionNullable:
Polls are a flawed mechanism for estimating the probabilities of an election outcome.  Sample sizes are small and data scientists need to work hard to overcome these.  But these flaws do not exist in betting markets, where punters are financially incentivised to get the call right.  Perhaps we should say betting markets are 'less flawed' than polls.

The inverse of betting odds should provide the least biased estimate of the probability that each candidate has of winning the election (you may also need to adjust for the bookmakers profit).  

This data is collected from a British bookmaker.  Why British and not American?  Well according to presidentialelectionodds.net in the US 'local brick-and-mortar sportsbooks and domestic online betting sites don't offer political betting lines. In most cases, there are no state laws against the practice, but it’s effectively a tradition that US sportsbooks refrain from offering odds on candidates and other election and political fare. This could change in the future, but for now, if you want to wager on politics, you can only do so at reputable offshore betting sites.'

As at January 2024, the Matchbook exchange indicates that they have received matched volume in total of c.GBP900,000 on this event.
